|- wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), w0))))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffss(s1, s2)
-| diffsw(s0, w0)
-| diffss(s0, s2)

comment: A less restrictive version of the Separation Scheme ~ axsep , where variables ` x ` and ` z ` can both appear free in the wff ` ph ` , which can therefore be thought of as ` ph ( x , z ) ` . This version was derived from the more restrictive ~ ax-sep with no additional set theory axioms. (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.)
